Centralized digital services, whether in traditional finance or in the crypto biz, are extremely vulnerable to local lawsuits and political pressure. They will be increasingly censored year by year as political activists continue to learn more about these fat tempting targets.https://twitter.com/reallife_ck/status/995289807122132992 …

Also a reminder that append-only databases existed before, P2P protocols, cryptography and linked lists existed before. Ask yourself: if old tools could solve modern problems, why no one used them before, for your use case? What fundamentally changed? Why now?

Of course you might be able to use cryptography to enhance (secure) existing processes with digital signatures, hashes etc. but 1/ this is not blockchain 2/ there is always a trade off (performance, UX, ...) 3/ this is not a revolution
